medical_history.chief_complaint: Erythema and swelling of the left index finger.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 days ago with a small itching area that Mr. M believed to be a mosquito bite. Over two days, the redness, pain, and swelling worsened and spread, leading to an inability to close his fist, prompting him to seek care.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr. M has a history of familial hypercholesterolemia and had one previous episode of a possible skin infection about 6 months ago, treated with an unknown oral antibiotic. He has also experienced episodes of dyshidrotic eczema in the past but denies any current issues.
medical_history.family_history: Mr. Mâ€™s young son has recurrent otitis media and has taken multiple courses of antibiotics recently.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. M is a senior manager who travels frequently within the U.S., exercises regularly by biking, jogging, and swimming, and lives with his wife and toddler son. He denies use of antibiotics except for the last skin infection.
